column1: Gropiusstadt (German pronunciation ) is a locality (Ortsteil) within the Berlin borough (Bezirk) of Neukölln. It was named after the architect who projected the complex: Walter Gropius.

column2: initially named Britz-Buckow-Rudow and projected in a modernist style by Walter Gropius
column4: Gropius also projected the Sommerfeld House
column5: the Interbau and the Großsiedlung Siemensstadt quarter. As part of West Berlin
column6: its borders with Brandenburg (part of East Germany) were crossed by the Berlin Wall from 1961 to 1989. As of 2001 it was still an autonomous Ortsteil.It became infamous as the place in which the German writer Christiane F. lived from childhood to adolescence
column7: author of the novel "Wir Kinder vom Bahnhof Zoo".

column1: Gropiusstadt is located in the eastern suburb of Berlin and a small part of it (the easternmost one) borders with Schönefeld

column4: Rudow and Buckow. This locality also separates Buckow from its northern exclave
